alert.note: Alert for St. Francois; Washington (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:37PM CST until February 19 at 10:12PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in east central Missouri, Crawford and Washington. In southeast Missouri, Iron, Madison, Reynolds and Saint Francois. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 229 PM CST, Local law enforcement reported 9 road closures in Washington and Iron counties due to ongoing flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Desloge, Fredericktown, Potosi, Steelville, Bismarck, Ironton, Leadwood, Anthonies Mill, Park Hills, Reynolds, Pilot Knob, Iron Mountain Lake, Viburnum, Arcadia, Irondale, Mineral Point, Belleview, Courtois and Bixby.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
